content:
Good evening,

Today during lecture my computer's display turned off. I am using a Macbook Pro that was borrowed from IS&T. I have contacted them about a replacement and I was told to "sit tight" until a new one is shipped (hopefully before the final). I've tried many keyboard shortcuts to boot up the laptop but to no avail. I have pset 4 halfway done, but now I have no access to it, and I do not have access to another personal computer at this time. What can I do? Thank you for any flexibility that can be provided.
subject: Loaner Laptop Bricked - Cannot access files

content: @Ana Bell is there anything we can do about this?

If you get S3 support we can give you an extension of 1 day, meaning that you can submit the pset by Sunday night (and get the checkoff by Monday night). Unfortunately you'll have to recreate the code. 

1) Do you have a friend who can let you borrow a laptop? 

2) There are public Athena machines you can use, which have Python installed on them. They don't have Spyder, but do have an IDE called IDLE. See this map for these computing clusters: https://ist.mit.edu/sites/default/files/getting_started/ComputingMap.pdf
This is probably a long shot but if you hold down the power button for 20+ seconds it may restart/reboot the laptop.

Yesterday, I was able to get to the Apple Logo where the loading bar would start, but then the device flickered a tiled, static version of the screen for a brief moment and turned off again. Now as of today, the device won't even turn on at all. I appreciate the help though :)
